title: Introduction to Color Theory
description: Learn the fundamentals of color theory, including primary, secondary, and tertiary colors, and how the color wheel helps in understanding color relationships.

title: Properties of Color
description: Explore the key properties of color, such as hue, saturation, luminance, tints, tones, and shades, and their impact on design and perception.

title: Color Harmony
description: Understand the principles of color harmony, including complementary, analogous, triadic, and monochromatic schemes, to create balanced and visually appealing designs.

title: Emotional Impact of Colors
description: Discover how colors influence emotions, moods, and cultural perceptions, and learn how to use color to evoke specific feelings in your designs.

title: Designing with Color Palettes
description: Learn how to create and use color palettes effectively, including warm, cool, and neutral palettes, and tools for generating the perfect palette.

title: Color Contrast and Accessibility
description: Learn the importance of color contrast for readability and accessibility, including guidelines for contrast ratios and designing for inclusive experiences.

title: Color in Digital Media vs. Print
description: Understand the differences between RGB and CMYK color models, and get tips for designing for digital screens and print media.

title: Common Mistakes in Color Usage
description: Avoid common pitfalls in color usage, such as overuse of vibrant colors, ignoring color harmony, and neglecting accessibility considerations.
